segments.text: I see the woman at the sink, her focus unwavering on the plate she's drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost comical how unaware she is of the flood building at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascades over the edge of the sink, pooling on the floor, and yet she carries on as if nothing is amiss.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but wonder if sheâ€™s so lost in her routine that she cannot see the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are like little thieves, sneaking cookies while their mother is oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's precarious balance on the stool sends a shiver through me; it seems so unsafe.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I admire the girl's eagerness, her little arm reaching up with anticipation, but it feels risky.
segments.speaker: PAR
